title: Tuskegee Institute National Historic Site: Safety
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Safety            Safety       To have a safe and enjoyable visit to the Tuskegee Institute National Historic Site, plan to do the following:  Wear clothing appropriate for the season and temperature (see Weather) Store all valuables in your vehicle out of site of passers-by. Lock your vehicle when you leave it in the parking area. Wear sturdy footwear that support your walk throughout the historic site. Bring water as needed to help ward off heat exhaustion. Apply sunscreen and/or insect repellant as needed. Heed all directional and warning signs--they are for your benefit.
